oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FULLY PROBABILISTIC DUNE SAFETY ASSESSMENT USING AN ADVANCED PROBABILISTIC METHOD
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: den Bieman, Joost P.
Stuparu, Dana E.
Hoonhout, Bas M.
Diermanse, Ferdinand L.M.
Boers, Marien
van Geer, Pieter F.C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: probabilistics
dune erosion
XBeach
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, an advanced probabilistic method - Adaptive Directional Importance Sampling (ADIS) - is used in concert with a process-based dune erosion model - XBeach - to perform a dune safety assessment. The efficiency of the probabilistic method removes the restriction of only using simple empirical dune erosion models for probabilistic calculations. The proposed combination of ADIS and XBeach is able to handle complex cross-shore profiles that empirical dune erosion models cannot, as shown in several case studies.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; management.9
